theme.usq
  • Get Started
  • Reference
  • News

Basic Boxplots Using USQ Colours and Typography

Basic boxplots that follow USQ colour and typography guidelines that uses (hopefully) sensible defaults.

boxplot_usq(x, main = "", sub = "", xlab = "", ylab = "", col = 1,
  ...)

Arguments

main

Main title. Optional, if not supplied it will be blank.
sub

Sub title below x-axis label. Optional, if not supplied it will be blank.
xlab

X-axis label. Optional.
ylab

Y-axis label. Optional.
col

Colour to use as fill for the boxes as a digit. Defaults to 1, USQ Charcoal. There are six colours that can be used, see Details for more.

Details

Colours for use in plots from the USQ Visual Identity Palette as a valid value for col include:

  • 1 - USQ Charcoal

  • 2 - USQ Yellow

  • 3 - Dark Warm Gray

  • 4 - Support Green

  • 5 - Secondary Orange

  • 6 - Support Blue

Examples

rb <- boxplot_usq(decrease ~ treatment, data = OrchardSprays)
title("Comparing boxplot()s and non-robust mean +/- SD")
